solution_line_template: Marnie bought {beads_per_small_bag} x {num_small_bags} = <<{beads_per_small_bag}*{num_small_bags}={beads_from_small_bags}>>{beads_from_small_bags} beads from the {num_small_bags} bags of {beads_per_small_bag} beads.

She also bought {beads_per_large_bag} x {num_large_bags} = <<{beads_per_large_bag}*{num_large_bags}={beads_from_large_bags}>>{beads_from_large_bags} beads from the {num_large_bags} bags of {beads_per_large_bag} beads.
She has a total of {beads_from_small_bags} + {beads_from_large_bags} = <<{beads_from_small_bags}+{beads_from_large_bags}={total_beads}>>{total_beads} beads.
Hence, she will be able to make {total_beads}/{beads_per_bracelet} = <<{total_beads}/{beads_per_bracelet}={num_bracelets}>>{num_bracelets} bracelets.
